content.query:
USE nyc_taxi_discovery

-- Check for duplicates in the Taxi zone data
SELECT
    location_id,
    COUNT(1) AS number_of_records
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@devsynpasedl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIRSTROW = 2,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) 
    WITH(
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    )AS [result]
    GROUP BY location_id;


-- Using HAVING clause to return more than 1 record
SELECT
    location_id,
    COUNT(1) AS number_of_records
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@devsynpasedl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIRSTROW = 2,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) 
    WITH(
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    )AS [result]
    GROUP BY location_id
    HAVING COUNT(1) > 1;


SELECT
    borough,
    COUNT(1) AS number_of_records
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@devsynpasedl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIRSTROW = 2,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) 
    WITH(
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    )AS [result]
    GROUP BY borough
    HAVING COUNT(1) > 1;
